The only way that this should happen is if there is an old version of
org.eclipse.mylar.core laying around, which doesn?t have that actionObserved
method, or installing the core failed somehow.

Please try the following in the Manage Configuration dialog:
1.	Right-click to disable all of the visible mylar features and allow Eclipse to
restart
2.	Right-click each of the visible Mylar features to uninstall it (make sure
that the ?Show Disabled Features? toolbar button is pressed).  You only need to
restart after the last one is uninstalled.
3.	Re-install Mylar from the update site

Fixed by following steps above.  This should not happen, but for now we will
assume that the problem is not on our end.
